title: Mum claims son's painful eczema was cured thanks to £2.60 cream from Aldi
text:

A mum may have finally cured her son's painful eczema - thanks to a £2.60 miracle cream she found in Aldi.

Sarah Boyd didn't know where to turn after trying everything to help nine-year-old Ben, who suffered from the skin condition all his life.

After countless GP appointments nothing was working - and the family were running out of ideas.

The eczema left him with cracked and bleeding feet and he even found it painful to put his shoes on and walk.

Sarah, 43, would have to cut off the flaking skin with nail clippers after things got worse in the last year - but help was soon at hand.

(Image: Triangle News)

(Image: Triangle News)

But Ben has now been cured after they tried the Palmer's Cocoa Butter which was on sale at the budget supermarket chain.

Receptionist Sarah said: "Absolutely nothing was working. It was absolutely heartbreaking."

After discovering the product in Aldi she added: "It was brilliant, I felt like crying in the morning when I saw his feet."

(Image: Triangle News)

"It was amazing. The next day it was like he had completely different feet. He was as shocked as me. It's made a huge difference."

Now Ben of Caerphilly, South Wales, can run around with his younger brother Oliver, eight, once again and play sport.

Ben said: "It used to be hurting, blistering and bleeding all the time.

(Image: Triangle News)

"I feel way better, it's like having new feet."

Sarah added she hopes the cream might be able to help other children suffering with eczema.

"I just want everybody to know how it's helped Ben," she said.
description: Ben Boyd, from Caerphilly, Wales, says it's "like having new feet" after stumbling on a cut-price solution to his skin condition
